intro: Sinosenecio leiboensis, commonly known as the Leibo's sinosenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions, preferring cool and moist environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
